cards.name: Cellar
cards.description:
+1 Action
Discard any number of cards, then draw that many.

cards.name: Chapel
cards.description: Trash up to 4 cards from your hand.

cards.name: Moat
cards.description:
+2 Cards
———-
When another player plays an Attack card, you may first reveal this from your hand, to be unaffected by it.

cards.name: Harbinger
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Look through your discard pile. You may put a card from it onto your deck.

cards.name: Merchant
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
The first time you play a Silver this turn, +$1.

cards.name: Vassal
cards.description: Discard the top card of your deck. If it’s an Action card, you may play it.

cards.name: Village
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions.

cards.name: Workshop
cards.description: Gain a card costing up to $4.

cards.name: Bureaucrat
cards.description: Gain a silver card; put it on top of your deck. Each other player reveals a Victory card from his hand and puts it on his deck (or reveals a hand with no Victory cards).

cards.name: Gardens
cards.description: Worth 1 Victory for every 10 cards in your deck (rounded down).

cards.name: Militia
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player discards down to 3 cards in their hand.

cards.name: Moneylender
cards.description: You may trash a Copper from your hand. If you do, +$3.

cards.name: Poacher
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
Discard a card per empty Supply pile.

cards.name: Remodel
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $2 more than the trashed card.

cards.name: Smithy
cards.description: +3 Cards.

cards.name: Throne Room
cards.description: You may play an Action card from your hand twice.

cards.name: Bandit
cards.description: Gain a Gold. Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes a revealed Treasure other than Copper, and discards the rest.

cards.name: Council Room
cards.description:
+4 Cards
+1 Buy
Each other player draws a card.

cards.name: Festival
cards.description:
+2 Actions
+1 Buy
+$2.

cards.name: Laboratory
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+1 Action.

cards.name: Library
cards.description: Draw until you have 7 cards in hand, skipping any Action cards you choose to; set those aside, discarding them afterwards.

cards.name: Market
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+1 Buy
+$1.

cards.name: Mine
cards.description: You may trash a Treasure from your hand. Gain a Treasure to your hand costing up to $3 more than it.

cards.name: Sentry
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Trash and/or discard any number of them. Put the rest back on top in any order.

cards.name: Witch
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Each other player gains a Curse card.

cards.name: Artisan
cards.description: Gain a card to your hand costing up to $5. Put a card from your hand onto your deck.

cards.name: Chancellor
cards.description:
+$2
You may immediately put your deck into your discard pile.

cards.name: Feast
cards.description: Trash this card. Gain a card costing up to $5.

cards.name: Spy
cards.description:
+1 Card; +1 Action
Each player (including you) reveals the top card of his deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice.

cards.name: Thief
cards.description: Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck. If they revealed any Treasure cards, they trash one of them that you choose. You may gain any or all of these trashed cards. They discard the other revealed cards.

cards.name: Adventurer
cards.description:
+1 Card; +1 Action
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Coppers and Potions into your hand. Put the other cards back on top in any order.

cards.name: Courtyard
cards.description:
+3 Cards
Put a card from your hand onto your deck.

+1 Action
Choose one: Trash an Action card from the Supply; or gain an Action card from the trash.

cards.name: Pawn
cards.description: Choose two: +1 Card; +1 Action; +1 Buy; +$1. The choices must be different.

cards.name: Masquerade
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Each player with any cards in hand passes one to the next such player to their left, at once. Then you may trash a card from your hand.

cards.name: Shanty Town
cards.description:
+2 Actions
Reveal your hand. If you have no Action cards in hand, +2 Cards.

cards.name: Steward
cards.description: Choose one: +2 Cards; or +$2; or trash 2 cards from your hand.

cards.name: Swindler
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player trashes the top card of their deck and gains a card with the same cost that you choose.

cards.name: Wishing Well
cards.description:
+1 Card; +1 Action
Name a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If you name it, put it in your hand.

cards.name: Baron
cards.description:
+1 Buy
You may discard an Estate for +$4. If you don’t gain an Estate.

cards.name: Bridge
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$1
This turn, cards (everywhere) cost $1 less, but not less than $0.

cards.name: Conspirator
cards.description:
+$2
If you’ve played 3 or more Actions this turn (counting this), +1 Card and +1 Action.

cards.name: Diplomat
cards.description:
+2 Cards
If you have 5 or fewer cards in hand (after drawing), +2 Actions.
———-
When another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from a hand of 5 or more cards, to draw 2 cards then discard 3.

cards.name: Ironworks
cards.description:
Gain a card costing up to $4. If the gained card is an…
Action card, +1 Action
Treasure card, +$1
Victory card, +1 Card

cards.name: Mill
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
You may discard 2 cards, for +$2.
———-
1 VP

cards.name: Mining Village
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
You may trash this for +$2.

cards.name: Secret Passage
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+1 Action
Take a card from your hand and put it anywhere in your deck.

cards.name: Courtier
cards.description: Reveal a card from your hand. For each type it has (Action, Attack, etc.), choose one: +1 Action; or +1 Buy; or +$3; or gain a Gold. The choices must be different.

cards.name: Duke
cards.description: Worth 1 Victory Point per Duchy you have.

cards.name: Minion
cards.description:
+1 Action
Choose one: +$2; or discard your hand, +4 Cards, and each other player with at least 5 cards in hand discards their hand and draws 4 cards.

cards.name: Patrol
cards.description:
+3 Cards
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the Victory cards and Curses into your hand. Put the rest back in any order.

cards.name: Replace
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $2 more than it. If the gained card is an Action or Treasure, put it onto your deck; if it’s a Victory card, each other player gains a Curse.

cards.name: Torturer
cards.description:
+3 Cards
Each other player either discards 2 cards or gains a Curse to their hand, their choice. (They may pick an option they can’t do.)

cards.name: Trading Post
cards.description: Trash 2 cards from your hand. If you did, gain a Silver to your hand.

cards.name: Upgrade
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing exactly $1 more than it.

cards.name: Harem
cards.description:
$2
———-
2 Victory Points

cards.name: Nobles
cards.description:
Choose one: +3 Cards; or +2 Actions.
———-
2 Victory Points

cards.name: Secret Chamber
cards.description:
Discard any number of cards. +$1 per card discarded.
When another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, +2 cards, then put 2 cards from your hand on top of your deck.

cards.name: Great Hall
cards.description:
1 Victory Point
+1 Card; +1 Action.

cards.name: Coppersmith
cards.description: Copper produces an extra $1 this turn.

cards.name: Scout
cards.description:
+1 Action
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Victory cards into your hand. Put the other cards on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Saboteur
cards.description: Each other player reveals cards from the top of his deck until revealing one costing $3 or more. He trashes that card and may gain a card costing at most $2 less than it. He discards the other revealed cards.

cards.name: Tribute
cards.description: The player to your left reveals then discards the top 2 cards of his deck. For each differently named card revealed, if it is an… Action Card; +2 Actions; Treasure Card; +$2; Victory Card; +2 Cards.

cards.name: Embargo
cards.description:
+$2
Trash this. Add an Embargo token to a Supply pile. (For the rest of the game, when a player buys a card from that pile, they gain a Curse.)

cards.name: Haven
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Set aside a card from your hand face down (under this). At the start of your next turn, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Lighthouse
cards.description:
+1 Action
Now and at the start of your next turn: +$1.
———-
While this is in play, when another player plays an Attack card, it doesn’t affect you.

cards.name: Native Village
cards.description:
+2 Actions
Choose one: Put the top card of your deck face down on your Native Village mat (you may look at those cards at any time); or put all the cards from your mat into your hand.

cards.name: Pearl Diver
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Look at the bottom card of your deck. You may put it on top.

cards.name: Ambassador (part II)
cards.description: Reveal a card from your hand. Return up to 2 copies of it from your hand to the Supply. Then each other player gains a copy of it.

cards.name: Fishing Village
cards.description:
+2 Actions
+$1
At the start of your next turn: +1 Action and +$1.

cards.name: Lookout
cards.description:
+1 Action
Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash one of them. Discard one of them. Put the other one back on to your deck.

cards.name: Smugglers
cards.description: Gain a copy of a card costing up to $6 that the player to your right gained on their last turn.

cards.name: Warehouse
cards.description:
+3 Cards
+1 Action
Discard 3 cards.

cards.name: Caravan
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
At the start of your next turn, +1 Card.

cards.name: Cutpurse
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player discards a Copper (or reveals a hand with no Copper).

cards.name: Island
cards.description:
Put this and a card from your hand onto your Island mat.
———-
2 Victory Points

cards.name: Navigator
cards.description:
+$2
Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Either discard them all, or put them back in any order.

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.description: Choose one: +$1 per Coin token on your Pirate Ship mat; or each other player reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, trashes one of those Treasures that you choose, and discards the rest, and then if anyone trashed a Treasure you add a Coin token to your Pirate Ship mat.

cards.name: Salvager
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Trash a card from your hand. +$1 per $1 it costs.

cards.name: Sea Hag
cards.description: Each other player discards the top card of their deck, then gains a Curse onto their deck.

cards.name: Treasure Map
cards.description: Trash this and a Treasure Map from your hand. If you trashed two Treasure Maps, gain 4 Golds onto your deck.

cards.name: Bazaar
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
+$1.

cards.name: Explorer
cards.description: You may reveal a Province from your hand. If you do, gain a Gold to your hand. If you don’t, gain a Silver to your hand.

cards.name: Ghost Ship
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand puts cards from their hand onto their deck until they have 3 cards in hand.

cards.name: Merchant Ship
cards.description: Now and at the start of your next turn: +$2.

cards.name: Outpost
cards.description: If this is the first time you played an Outpost this turn, and the previous turn wasn’t yours, then take an extra turn after this one, and you only draw 3 cards for your next hand.

cards.name: Tactician
cards.description: If you have at least one card in hand, discard your hand, and at the start of your next turn, +5 Cards, +1 Action, and +1 Buy.

cards.name: Treasury
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
When you discard this from play, if you didn’t buy a Victory card this turn, you may put this onto your deck.

cards.name: Wharf
cards.description: Now and at the start of your next turn: +2 Cards and +1 Buy.

cards.name: Herbalist
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$1
———-
When you discard this from play, you may put one of your Treasures from play onto your deck.

cards.name: Potion
cards.description: Worth 1◉.

cards.name: Apprentice
cards.description:
+1 Action
Trash a card from your hand. +1 Card per $1 it costs. +2 Cards if it has ◉ in its cost.

cards.name: Transmute
cards.description:
Trash a card from your hand. If it’s an…
Action card, gain a Duchy
Treasure card, gain a Transmute
Victory card, gain a Gold

cards.name: Vineyard
cards.description: Worth 1 Victory Point per 3 Action cards in your deck (round down).

cards.name: Apothecary
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Coppers and Potions into your hand. Put the rest back in any order.

cards.name: Scrying Pool
cards.description:
+1 Action
Each player (including you) reveals the top card of their deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice. Then reveal cards from your deck until revealing one that isn’t an Action. Put all of those revealed cards into your hand.

cards.name: University
cards.description:
+2 Actions
You may gain an Action card costing up to $5.

cards.name: Alchemist
cards.description:
+2 Card
+1 Action
———-
When you discard this from play, if you have a Potion in play, you may put this onto your deck.

cards.name: Familiar
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Each other player gains a curse.

cards.name: Philosopher’s Stone
cards.description: When you play this, count your deck and discard pile. Worth $1 per 5 cards total between them (round down).

cards.name: Golem
cards.description: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 2 Action cards other than Golems. Discard the other cards, then play the Action cards in either order.

cards.name: Possession
cards.description: The player to your left takes an extra turn after this one, in which you can see all cards they can and make all decisions for them. Any cards or tokens they would gain on that turn, you gain instead; any cards of theirs that are trashed are set aside and put in their discard pile at end of turn.

cards.name: Loan
cards.description:
$1
When you play this, reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Treasure. Discard it or trash it. Discard the other cards.

cards.name: Trade Route
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Trash a card from your hand. +$1 per Coin token on the Trade Route mat.
———-
Setup: Add a Coin token to each Victory Supply pile. When a card is gained from that pile, move the token to the Trade Route mat.

cards.name: Watchtower
cards.description:
Draw until you have 6 cards in hand.
———-
When you gain a card, you may reveal this from your hand, to either trash that card or put it onto your deck.

cards.name: Bishop
cards.description:
+$1
+1 VP
Trash a card from your hand. +1 VP per $2 it costs (round down).
Each other player may trash a card from their hand.

cards.name: Quarry
cards.description:
$1.
———-
While this is in play, Action cards cost $2 less, but not less than $0.

cards.name: Talisman
cards.description:
$1.
———-
While this is in play, when you buy a non-Victory card costing $4 or less, gain a copy of it.

cards.name: Worker’s Village
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
+1 Buy

cards.name: City
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
If there are one or more empty Supply piles, +1 Card. If there are two or more, +$1 and +1 Buy.

cards.name: Contraband
cards.description:
$3
+1 Buy
When you play this, the player to your left names a card. You can’t buy that card this turn.

cards.name: Counting House
cards.description: Look through your discard pile, reveal any number of Coppers from it, and put them into your hand.

cards.name: Mint
cards.description:
You may reveal a Treasure card from your hand. Gain a copy of it.
———-
When you buy this, trash all Treasures you have in play.

cards.name: Mountebank
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player may discard a Curse. If they don’t, they gain a Curse and a Copper.

cards.name: Rabble
cards.description:
+3 Cards
Each other player reveals the top 3 cards of their deck, discards the Actions and Treasures, and puts the rest back in any order they choose.

cards.name: Royal Seal
cards.description:
Worth $2
———-
While this is in play, when you gain a card, you may put that card onto your deck.

cards.name: Vault
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Discard any number of cards for +$1 each.
Each other player may discard 2 cards, to draw a card.

cards.name: Venture
cards.description:
Worth $1
When you play this, reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Treasure. Discard the rest, then play the Treasure.

cards.name: Goons
cards.description:
+1 Buy; +$2
Each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand.
———-
While this is in play, when you buy a card, +1 VP token.

cards.name: Grand Market
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+1 Buy
+$2
———-
You can’t buy this if you have any Coppers in play.

cards.name: Hoard
cards.description:
Worth $2.
———-
While this is in play, when you buy a Victory card, gain a Gold.

cards.name: Bank
cards.description:
Worth $?
When you play this, it’s worth $1 per Treasure card you have in play (counting this).

cards.name: Expand
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $3 more than it.

cards.name: Forge
cards.description: Trash any number of cards from your hand. Gain a card with cost exactly equal to the total cost in $ of the trashed cards.

cards.name: King’s Court
cards.description: You may play an Action card from your hand three times.

cards.name: Peddler
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
———-
During your Buy phase, this costs $2 less per Action card you have in play, but not less than $0.

cards.name: Platinum
cards.description: Worth $5

cards.name: Colony
cards.description: 10 Victory Points

cards.name: Hamlet
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
You may discard a card for +1 Action.
You may discard a card for +1 Buy.

cards.name: Fortune Teller
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player reveals cards from the top of their deck until they reveal a Victory card or Curse. They put it on top and discard the rest.

cards.name: Menagerie
cards.description:
+1 Action
Reveal your hand. If the revealed cards all have different names, +3 Cards. Otherwise, +1 Card.

cards.name: Farming Village
cards.description:
+2 Actions
Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal an Action or Treasure card. Put that card into your hand and discard the rest.

cards.name: Horse Traders
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$3
Discard 2 cards.
———-
When another player plays an Attack card, you may first set this aside from your hand. If you do, then at the start of your next turn, +1 Card and return this to your hand.

cards.name: Remake
cards.description: Do this twice: Trash a card from your hand, then gain a card costing exactly $1 more than it.

cards.name: Tournament
cards.description:
+1 Action
Each player may reveal a Province from their hand. If you do, discard it and gain any Prize (from the Prize pile) or a Duchy, onto your deck. If no-one else does, +1 Card and +$1.

cards.name: Young Witch
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Discard 2 cards. Each other player may reveal a Bane card from their hand; if they don’t, they gain a Curse.
———-
Setup: Add an extra Kingdom card pile costing $2 or $3 to the Supply. Cards from that pile are Bane cards.

cards.name: Harvest
cards.description: Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck, then discard them. +$1 per differently named card revealed.

cards.name: Horn of Plenty
cards.description:
Worth $0.
When you play this, gain a card costing up to $1 per differently named card you have in play (counting this). If it’s a Victory card, trash this.

cards.name: Hunting Party
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action.
Reveal your hand. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal one that isn’t a copy of one in your hand. Put it into your hand and discard the rest.

cards.name: Jester
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player discards the top card of their deck. If it’s a Victory card they gain a Curse; otherwise they gain a copy of the discarded card or you do, your choice.

cards.name: Fairgrounds
cards.description: Worth 2VP for every 5 differently named cards in your deck (round down).

cards.name: Bag of Gold
cards.description:
+1 Action
Gain a Gold onto your deck.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Diadem
cards.description:
Worth $2.
When you play this, +$1 per unused Action you have (Action, not Action card).
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Followers
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Gain an Estate. Each other player gains a Curse and discards down to 3 cards in hand.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Princess
cards.description:
+1 Buy
While this is in play, cards cost $2 less, but not less than $0.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Trusty Steed
cards.description: Choose two: +2 Cards; +2 Actions; +$2; gain 4 Silvers and put your deck into your discard pile.

cards.name: Crossroads
cards.description: Reveal your hand. +1 Card per Victory card revealed. If this is the first time you played a Crossroads this turn, +3 Actions.

cards.name: Duchess
cards.description:
+$2
Each player (including you) looks at the top card of their deck and may discard it.
———-
If Duchess is in the Supply, you may gain one when you gain a Duchy.

cards.name: Fool’s Gold
cards.description:
Worth $1 if it’s the first time you played a Fool’s Gold this turn, otherwise worth $4.
———-
When another player gains a Province, you may trash this from your hand, to gain a Gold onto your deck.

cards.name: Develop
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. Gain two cards onto your deck, with one costing exactly $1 more than it, and one costing exactly $1 less than it, in either order.

cards.name: Oasis
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
Discard a card.

cards.name: Oracle
cards.description: Each player (including you) reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, and discards them or puts them back, your choice. They choose the order to return them. Afterwards, you draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Scheme
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
This turn, you may put one of your Action cards onto your deck when you discard it from play.

cards.name: Tunnel
cards.description:
2 Victory Points
———-
When you discard this other than during Clean-up, you may reveal it to gain a Gold.

cards.name: Jack of All Trades
cards.description:
Gain a Silver.
Look at the top card of your deck; you may discard it.
Draw until you have 5 cards in hand.
You may trash a non-Treasure card from your hand.

cards.name: Noble Brigand
cards.description:
+$1
When you buy or play this, each other player reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, trashes a revealed Silver or Gold you choose, discards the rest, and gains a Copper if they didn’t reveal a Treasure. You gain the trashed cards.

cards.name: Nomad Camp
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$2
———-
This is gained onto your deck (instead of to your discard pile).

cards.name: Silk Road
cards.description: Worth 1 Victory Point per 4 Victory cards you have (round down).

cards.name: Spice Merchant
cards.description:
You may trash a Treasure from your hand. If you do, choose one:
+2 Cards and +1 Action; or +1 Buy and $2.

cards.name: Trader
cards.description:
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a Silver per $1 it costs.
———-
When you would gain a card, you may reveal this from your hand, to instead gain a Silver.

cards.name: Cache
cards.description:
Worth $3
—
When you gain this, gain 2 Coppers.

cards.name: Cartographer
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Discard any number of them, then put the rest back in any order.

cards.name: Embassy
cards.description:
+5 Cards
Discard 3 cards.
——
When you gain this, each other player gains a Silver.

cards.name: Haggler
cards.description:
+$2
———-
While this is in play, when you buy a card, gain a cheaper non-Victory card.

cards.name: Highway
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
——–
While this is in play, cards cost $1 less, but not less than $0.

cards.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
cards.description:
Worth $1
When you play this, you may gain a Copper to your hand.
———
When you gain this, each other player gains a Curse.

cards.name: Inn
cards.description:
+2 Cards; +2 Actions
Discard 2 cards.
———-
When you gain this, look through your discard pile, reveal any number of Action cards from it (which can include this), and shuffle them into your deck.

cards.name: Mandarin
cards.description:
+$3
Put a card from your hand on top of your deck.
—
When you gain this, put all Treasures you have in play onto your deck in any order.

cards.name: Margrave
cards.description:
+3 Cards
+1 Buy
Each other player draws a card, then discards down to 3 cards in hand.

cards.name: Stables
cards.description: You may discard a Treasure, for +3 Cards and +1 Action.

cards.name: Border Village
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
———-
When you gain this, gain a cheaper card.

cards.name: Farmland
cards.description:
2 VP
———-
When you buy this, trash a card from your hand and gain a card costing exactly $2 more than it.
/td>

cards.name: Poor House
cards.description:
+$4
Reveal your hand. -$1 per Treasure card in your hand. (You can’t go below $0.)

cards.name: Beggar
cards.description:
Gain 3 Coppers to your hand.
———-
When another player plays an Attack card, you may first discard this to gain 2 Silvers, putting one onto your deck.

cards.name: Squire
cards.description:
+$1
Choose one: +2 Actions; or +2 Buys; or gain a Silver.
___
When you trash this, gain an Attack card.

cards.name: Vagrant
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it’s a Curse, Ruins, Shelter, or Victory card, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Forager
cards.description:
+1 Action
+1 Buy
Trash a card from your hand, then +$1 per differently named Treasure in the trash.

cards.name: Hermit
cards.description:
Look through your discard pile. You may trash a non-Treasure card from your discard pile or hand. Gain a card costing up to $3.
———-
When you discard this from play, if you didn’t buy any cards this turn, trash this and gain a Madman from the Madman pile.

cards.name: Madman
cards.description:
+2 Actions
Return this to the Madman pile. If you do, +1 Card per card in your hand.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Market Square
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+1 Buy
———-
When one of your cards is trashed, you may discard this from your hand to gain a Gold.

cards.name: Sage
cards.description:
+1 Action
Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal one costing $3 or more. Put that card into your hand and discard the rest.

cards.name: Storeroom
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Discard any number of cards, then draw that many. Then discard any number of cards for +$1 each.

cards.name: Urchin
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Each other player discards down to 4 cards in hand.
———-
When you play another Attack card with this in play, you may first trash this, to gain a Mercenary from the Mercenary pile.

cards.name: Mercenary
cards.description:
You may trash 2 cards from your hand. If you do, +2 Cards, + $2, and each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Armory
cards.description: Gain a card onto your deck costing up to $4.

cards.name: Death Cart
cards.description:
+$5
You may trash an Action card from your hand. If you don’t, trash this.
___
When you gain this, gain two Ruins.

cards.name: Feodum
cards.description:
Worth 1 VP per 3 Silvers you have (round down).
———-
When you trash this, gain 3 Silvers.

cards.name: Fortress
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
___
When you trash this, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Ironmonger
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top card of your deck; you may discard it. Either way, if it’s an…
Action card, +1 Action
Treasure card, +$1
Victory card, +1 Card

cards.name: Marauder
cards.description: Gain a Spoils from the Spoils pile. Each other player gains a Ruins.

cards.name: Procession
cards.description: You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Trash it. Gain an Action card costing exactly $1 more than it.

cards.name: Rats
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Gain a Rats. Trash a card from your hand other than a Rats (or reveal a hand of all Rats).
———-
When you trash this, +1 Card.

cards.name: Scavenger
cards.description:
+$2
You may put your deck into your discard pile. Look through your discard pile and put one card from it onto your deck.

cards.name: Wandering Minstrel
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Put the Actions back on top in any order and discard the rest.

cards.name: Band of Misfits
cards.description: Play this as if it were a cheaper Action card in the Supply. This is that card until it leaves play.

cards.name: Bandit Camp
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
Gain a Spoils from the Spoils pile.

cards.name: Catacombs
cards.description:
Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Choose one: Put them into your hand; or discard them and +3 Cards.
___
When you trash this, gain a cheaper card.

cards.name: Count
cards.description:
Choose one: Discard 2 cards; or put a card from your hand onto your deck; or gain a Copper.
Choose one: +$3; trash your hand; or gain a Duchy.

cards.name: Counterfeit
cards.description:
$1
+1 Buy
When you play this, you may play a treasure from your hand twice. If you do, trash that treasure.

cards.name: Cultist
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Each other player gains a Ruins. You may play a Cultist from your hand.
___
When you trash this, +3 Cards.

cards.name: Graverobber
cards.description: Choose one: Gain a card from the trash costing from $3 to $6, onto your deck; or trash an Action card from your hand and gain a card costing up to $3 more than it.

cards.name: Junk Dealer
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
Trash a card from your hand.

cards.name: Mystic
cards.description:
+1 Action
+$2
Name a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If you named it, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.description: Trash this. Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand reveals their hand and discards a card that you choose. Gain 2 Spoils from the Spoils pile.

cards.name: Rebuild
cards.description:
+1 Action
Name a card. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Victory card you did not name. Discard the rest, trash the Victory card, and gain a Victory card costing up to $3 more than it..

cards.name: Rogue
cards.description:
+$2
If there are any cards in the trash costing from $3 to $6, gain one of them. Otherwise, each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest.

cards.name: Altar
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $5.

cards.name: Hunting Grounds
cards.description:
+4 Cards
———-
When you trash this, gain a Duchy or 3 Estates.

cards.name: Spoils
cards.description:
$3
When you play this, return it to the pile.

cards.name: Ruined Library
cards.description: +1 Card

cards.name: Ruined Market
cards.description: +1 Buy

cards.name: Ruined Village
cards.description: +1 Action

cards.name: Survivors
cards.description: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Discard them or put them back in any order.

cards.name: Knights
cards.description: Shuffle the Knight pile before each game with it. Keep it face down except for the top card, which is the only one that can be bought or gained.

cards.name: Dame Anna
cards.description:
You may trash up to 2 cards from your hand.
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Dame Josephine
cards.description:
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.
———-
Worth 2 VP

cards.name: Dame Molly
cards.description:
+2 Actions.
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Dame Natalie
cards.description:
You may gain a card costing up to $3.
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Dame Sylvia
cards.description:
+$2
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Sir Bailey
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Sir Destry
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Sir Martin
cards.description:
+2 Buys
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Sir Michael
cards.description:
Each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand.
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

cards.name: Sir Vander
cards.description:
Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.
———-
When you trash this, gain a Gold.

cards.name: Shelters
cards.description: Replaces starting Estates

cards.name: Hovel
cards.description: When you buy a Victory card, you may trash this from your hand.

cards.name: Necropolis
cards.description: +2 Actions

cards.name: Overgrown Estate
cards.description:
0 VP
___
When you trash this, +1 Card.

cards.name: Candlestick Maker
cards.description:
+1 Action.
+1 Buy.
Take a Coin token.

cards.name: Stonemason
cards.description:
Trash a card from your hand. Gain 2 cards each costing less than it.
—
When you buy this, you may overpay for it. If you do, gain 2 Action cards each costing the amount you overpaid.

cards.name: Doctor
cards.description:
Name a card. Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash the matches. Put the rest in any order.
—
When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look at the top card of your deck; trash it, discard it, or put it back.

cards.name: Masterpiece
cards.description:
Worth $1
—
When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look through your discard pile and put a card from it onto your deck..

cards.name: Advisor
cards.description:
+1 Action.
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. The player to your left chooses one of them. Discard that card and put the rest into your hand.

cards.name: Herald
cards.description:
+1 Card.
+1 Action.
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Action, play it.
—
When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look through your discard pile and put a card from it onto your deck.

cards.name: Plaza
cards.description:
+1 Card.
+2 Actions.
You may discard a Treasure to take a Coin token.

cards.name: Baker
cards.description:
+1 Card.
+1 Action.
Take a Coin token.
—
Setup: Each player takes a Coin token.

cards.name: Butcher
cards.description: Take 2 Coin tokens. You may trash a card from your hand. If you do, pay any number of Coin tokens, and gain a card with a cost of up to the cost of the trashed card plus the number of Coin tokens you paid.

cards.name: Journeyman
cards.description: Name a card. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 3 cards without that name. Put those cards into your hand and discard the rest.

cards.name: Merchant Guild
cards.description:
+1 Buy.
+$1.
—
While this is in play, when you buy a card, take a Coin token.

cards.name: Soothsayer
cards.description: Gain a Gold. Each other player gains a Curse, and if they did, draws a card.

cards.name: Coin of the Realm
cards.description:
Worth $1
When you play this, put it on your Tavern mat.
———-
Directly after you finish playing an Action card, you may call this, for +2 Actions.

cards.name: Page
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Treasure Hunter.

cards.name: Peasant
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$1
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Soldier.

cards.name: Ratcatcher
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
At the start of your turn, you may call this, to trash a card from your hand.

cards.name: Raze
cards.description:
+1 Action
Trash this or a card from your hand. Look at one card from your deck per $1 the trashed card costs. Put one of them into your hand and discard the rest.

cards.name: Amulet
cards.description: Now and at the start of your next turn, choose one: +$1; or trash a card from your hand; or gain a Silver.

cards.name: Caravan Guard
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
At the start of your next turn, +$1.
———-
When another player plays an Attack card, you may first play this from your hand.
(+1 Action has no effect if it’s not your turn.)

cards.name: Dungeon
cards.description:
+1 Action
Now and at the start of your next turn: +2 Cards, then discard 2 cards

cards.name: Gear
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Set aside up to 2 cards from your hand face down (under this). At the start of your next turn, put them into your hand.

cards.name: Guide
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
At the start of your turn, you may call this, to discard your hand and draw 5 cards.

cards.name: Duplicate
cards.description:
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
When you gain a card costing up to $6, you may call this, to gain a copy of that card.

cards.name: Magpie
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it’s a Treasure, put it into your hand. If it’s an Action or Victory card, gain a Magpie.

cards.name: Messenger
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$2
You may put your deck into your discard pile.
———-
When this is your first buy in a turn, gain a card costing up to $4, and each other player gains a copy of it.

cards.name: Miser
cards.description: Choose one: Put a Copper from your hand onto your Tavern mat; or +$1 per Copper on your Tavern mat.

cards.name: Port
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
———-
When you buy this, gain another Port.

cards.name: Ranger
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). Then if it’s face up, +5 Cards.

cards.name: Transmogrify
cards.description:
+1 Action.
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
At the start of your turn, you may call this, to trash a card from your hand, and gain a card costing up to $1 more than it into your hand.

cards.name: Artificer
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
Discard any number of cards. You may gain a card costing exactly $1 per card discarded, onto your deck.

cards.name: Bridge Troll
cards.description:
Each other player takes their -$1 token.
Now and at the start of your next turn: +1 Buy.
———-
While this is in play, cards cost $1 less on your turns, but not less than $0.

cards.name: Distant Lands
cards.description:
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
Worth 4 VP if on your Tavern mat at the end of the game (otherwise worth 0 VP).

cards.name: Giant
cards.description: Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). Then if it’s face down, +$1. If it’s face up, +$5, and each other player reveals the top card of their deck, trashes it if it costs from $3 to $6, and otherwise discards it and gains a Curse.

cards.name: Haunted Woods
cards.description:
Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, they put their hand onto their deck in any order.
At the start of your next turn, +3 Cards.

cards.name: Lost City
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+2 Actions
———-
When you gain this, each other player draws a card.

cards.name: Relic
cards.description:
Worth $2
When you play this, each other player puts their -1 Card token on their deck.

cards.name: Royal Carriage
cards.description:
+1 Action
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
Directly after you finish playing an Action card, if it’s still in play, you may call this, to replay that Action.

cards.name: Storyteller
cards.description:
+1 Action
+$1
Play up to 3 Treasures from your hand. Then pay all of your $ (including the $1 from this) and draw a card per $1 you paid.

cards.name: Swamp Hag
cards.description:
Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, they gain a Curse.
At the start of your next turn, +$3.

cards.name: Treasure Trove
cards.description:
Worth $2
When you play this, gain a Gold and a Copper.

cards.name: Wine Merchant
cards.description:
+$4
+1 Buy
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
At the end of your Buy phase, if you have at least $2 unspent, you may discard this from your Tavern mat.

cards.name: Hireling
cards.description:
At the start of each of your turns for the rest of the game: +1 Card.
(This stays in play.)

cards.name: Alms
cards.description: Once per turn: If you have no Treasures in play, gain a card costing up to $4.

cards.name: Borrow
cards.description: Once per turn: +1 Buy. If your -1 Card token isn’t on your deck, put it there and +$1.

cards.name: Quest
cards.description: You may discard an Attack, two Curses, or six cards. If you do, gain a Gold.

cards.name: Save
cards.description: Once per turn: +1 Buy. Set aside a card from your hand, and put it into your hand at end of turn (after drawing).

cards.name: Scouting Party
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Discard 3 and put the rest back in any order.

cards.name: Travelling Fair
cards.description:
+2 Buys
When you gain a card this turn, you may put it onto your deck.

cards.name: Bonfire
cards.description: Trash up to 2 cards you have in play.

cards.name: Expedition
cards.description: Draw 2 extra cards for your next hand.

cards.name: Ferry
cards.description: Move your -$2 cost token to an Action Supply pile. (Cards from that pile cost $2 less on your turns, but not less than $0.)

cards.name: Plan
cards.description: Move your Trashing token to an Action Supply pile (when you buy a card from that pile, you may trash a card from your hand.))

cards.name: Mission
cards.description: Once per turn: If the previous turn wasn’t yours, take another turn after this one, during which you can’t buy cards.

cards.name: Pilgrimage
cards.description: Once per turn: Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up); then if it’s face up, choose up to 3 differently named cards you have in play and gain a copy of each.

cards.name: Ball
cards.description: Take your -$1 token. Gain 2 cards each costing up to $4.

cards.name: Raid
cards.description: Gain a Silver per Silver you have in play. Each other player puts their -1 Card token on their deck.

cards.name: Seaway
cards.description: Gain an Action card costing up to $4. Move your +1 Buy token to its pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Buy.)

cards.name: Trade
cards.description: Trash up to 2 cards from your hand. Gain a Silver per card you trashed.

cards.name: Lost Arts
cards.description: Move your +1 Action token to an Action Supply pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Action.)

cards.name: Training
cards.description: Move your +$1 token to an Action Supply pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +$1.)

cards.name: Inheritance
cards.description: Once per game: Set aside a non-Victory Action card from the Supply costing up to $4. Move your Estate token to it. (Your Estates gain the abilities and types of that card.)

cards.name: Pathfinding
cards.description: Move your +1 Card token to an Action Supply pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Card.)

cards.name: Treasure Hunter
cards.description:
+1 Action
+$1
Gain a Silver per card the player to your right gained on their last turn.
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Warrior.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Warrior
cards.description:
+2 Cards
For each Traveller you have in play (including this), each other player discards the top card of their deck and trashes it if it costs $3 or $4.
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Hero.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Hero
cards.description:
+$2
Gain a Treasure.
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Champion.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Champion
cards.description:
+1 Action
For the rest of the game, when another player plays an Attack, it doesn’t affect you, and when you play an Action, +1 Action.
(This stays in play. This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Soldier
cards.description:
+$2
+$1 per other Attack you have in play. Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand discards a card.
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Fugitive.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Fugitive
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+1 Action
Discard a card.
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Disciple.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Disciple
cards.description:
You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Gain a copy of it.
———-
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Teacher.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Teacher
cards.description:
Put this on your Tavern mat.
———-
At the start of your turn, you may call this, to move your +1 Card, +1 Action, +1 Buy, or +$1 token to an Action Supply pile you have no tokens on. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get that bonus.)
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Engineer
cards.description: Gain a card costing up to $4. You may trash this. If you do, gain a card costing up to $4.

cards.name: City Quarter
cards.description:
+2 Actions
Reveal your hand. +1 Card per Action card revealed.)

cards.name: Overlord
cards.description: Play this as if it were an Action card in the Supply costing up to $5. This is that card until it leaves play.)

cards.name: Royal Blacksmith
cards.description:
+5 Cards
Reveal your hand; discard the Coppers.

cards.name: Encampment
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+2 Actions
You may reveal a Gold or Plunder from your hand. If you don’t, set this aside, and return it to the Supply at the start of Clean-up.
(This is the top half of the Encampment/Plunder pile.)

cards.name: Plunder
cards.description:
$2
+1 VP
(This is the bottom half of the Encampment/Plunder pile.)

cards.name: Patrician
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it costs $5 or more, put it into your hand.
(This is the top half of the Patrician/Emporium pile.)

cards.name: Emporium
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
+$1
———-
When you gain this, if you have at least 5 Action cards in play, +2 VP.
(This is the bottom half of the Patrician/Emporium pile.)

cards.name: Settlers
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Look through your discard pile. You may reveal a Copper from it and put it into your hand.
(This is the top half of the Settlers/Bustling Village pile.)

cards.name: Bustling Village
cards.description:
+1 Card
+3 Actions
Look through your discard pile. You may reveal a Settlers from it and put it into your hand.
(This is the bottom half of the Settlers/Bustling Village pile.)

cards.name: Castles
cards.description: See Castles section below.

cards.name: Catapult
cards.description:
+$1
Trash a card from your hand. If it costs $3 or more, each other player gains a Curse. If it’s a Treasure, each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand.
(This is the top half of the Catapult/Rocks pile.)

cards.name: Rocks
cards.description:
+$1
———-
When you gain or trash this, gain a Silver; if it’s your Buy phase, put the Silver on your deck, otherwise put it into your hand.
(This is the bottom half of the Catapult/Rocks pile.)

cards.name: Chariot Race
cards.description:
+1 Action
Reveal the top card of your deck and put it into your hand. The player to your left reveals the top card of their deck. If your card costs more, +$1 and +1 VP.

cards.name: Enchantress
cards.description:
Until your next turn, the first time each other player plays an Action card on their turn, they get +1 Card and +1 Action instead of following its instructions.
At the start of your next turn, +2 Cards.

cards.name: Farmer’s Market
cards.description:
+1 Buy
If there are 4 VP or more on the Farmers’ Market Supply pile, take them and trash this. Otherwise, add 1 VP to the pile and then +$1 per 1 VP on the pile.

cards.name: Gladiator
cards.description:
+$2
Reveal a card from your hand. The player to your left may reveal a copy from their hand. If they don’t, +$1 and trash a Gladiator from the Supply.
(This is the top half of the Gladiator/Fortune pile.)

cards.name: Fortune
cards.description:
+1 Buy
When you play this, double your $ if you haven’t yet this turn.
———-
When you gain this, gain a Gold per Gladiator you have in play.
(This is the bottom half of the Gladiator/Fortune pile.)

cards.name: Sacrifice
cards.description:
Trash a card from your hand. If it’s an…
Action card, +2 Cards, +2 Actions
Treasure card, +$2
Victory card, +2 VP

cards.name: Temple
cards.description:
+1 VP
Trash from 1 to 3 differently named cards from your hand. Add 1 VP to the Temple Supply pile.
———-
When you gain this, take the VP from the Temple Supply pile.

cards.name: Villa
cards.description:
+2 Actions
+1 Buy
+$1
———-
When you gain this, put it into your hand, +1 Action, and if it’s your Buy phase return to your Action phase.

cards.name: Archive
cards.description:
+1 Action
Set aside the top 3 cards of your deck face down (you may look at them). Now and at the start of your next two turns, put one into your hand.

cards.name: Capital
cards.description:
$6
+1 Buy
———-
When you discard this from play, take [6D], and then you may pay off [D].

cards.name: Charm
cards.description: When you play this, choose one: +1 Buy +$2; or the next time you buy a card this turn, you may also gain a differently named card with the same cost.

cards.name: Crown
cards.description:
If it’s your Action phase, you may play an Action from your hand twice.
If it’s your Buy phase, you may play a Treasure from your hand twice.

cards.name: Forum
cards.description:
+3 Cards
+1 Action
Discard 2 cards.
———-
When you buy this, +1 Buy.

cards.name: Groundskeepr
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
———-
While this is in play, when you gain a Victory card, +1 VP.

cards.name: Legionary
cards.description:
+$3
You may reveal a Gold from your hand. If you do, each other player discards down to 2 cards in hand, then draws a card.

cards.name: Wild Hunt
cards.description: Choose one: +3 Cards and add 1 VP to the Wild Hunt Supply pile; or gain an Estate, and if you do, take the VP from the pile.

cards.name: Humble Castle
cards.description:
$1
———-
Worth 1 VP per Castle you have.

cards.name: Crumbling Castle
cards.description:
1 VP
———-
When you gain or trash this, +1 VP and gain a Silver.

cards.name: Small Castle
cards.description:
Trash this or a Castle from your hand. If you do, gain a Castle.
———-
2 VP

cards.name: Haunted Castle
cards.description:
2 VP
———-
When you gain this during your turn, gain a Gold, and each other player with 5 or more cards in hand puts 2 cards from their hand onto their deck.

cards.name: Opulent Castle
cards.description:
Discard any number of Victory cards. +$2 per card discarded.
———-
3 VP

cards.name: Sprawling Castle
cards.description:
4 VP
———-
When you gain this, gain a Duchy or 3 Estates.

cards.name: Grand Castle
cards.description:
5 VP
———-
When you gain this, reveal your hand. +1 VP per Victory card in your hand and/or in play.

cards.name: King’s Castle
cards.description: Worth 2 VP per Castle you have.

cards.name: Advance
cards.description: You may trash an Action card from your hand. If you do, gain an Action card costing up to $6.

cards.name: Triumph
cards.description: Gain an Estate. If you did, +1 VP per card you’ve gained this turn.

cards.name: Annex
cards.description: Look through your discard pile. Choose up to 5 cards from it and shuffle the rest into your deck. Gain a Duchy.

cards.name: Donate
cards.description: After this turn, put all cards from your deck and discard pile into your hand, trash any number, shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

cards.name: Delve
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Gain a Silver.

cards.name: Tax
cards.description:
Add [2D] to a Supply pile.
Setup: Add [1D] to each Supply pile. When a player buys a card, they take the [D] from its pile.

cards.name: Banquet
cards.description: Gain two Coppers and a non-Victory card costing up to $5..

cards.name: Ritual
cards.description: Gain a Curse. If you do, trash a card from your hand. +1 VP per $1 it cost.

cards.name: Salt the Earth
cards.description:
+1 VP
Trash a Victory card from the Supply.

cards.name: Wedding
cards.description:
+1 VP
Gain a Gold.

cards.name: Windfall
cards.description: If your deck and discard pile are empty, gain 3 Golds.

cards.name: Conquest
cards.description: Gain 2 Silvers. +1 VP per Silver you’ve gained this turn.

cards.name: Dominate
cards.description: Gain a Province. If you do, +9 VP.

cards.name: Aqueduct
cards.description:
When you gain a Treasure, move 1 VP from its pile to this.
When you gain a Victory card, take the VP from this.
Setup: Put 8 VP on the Silver and Gold piles.

cards.name: Arena
cards.description:
At the start of your Buy phase, you may discard an Action card. If you do, take 2 VP from here.
Setup: Put 6 VP here per player.

cards.name: Bandit Fort
cards.description: When scoring, -2 VP for each Silver and each Gold you have.

cards.name: Basilica
cards.description:
When you buy a card, if you have $2 or more left, take 2 VP from here.
Setup: Put 6 VP here per player.

cards.name: Baths
cards.description:
When you end your turn without having gained a card, take 2 VP from here.
Setup: Put 6 VP here per player.

cards.name: Battlefield
cards.description:
When you gain a Victory card, take 2 VP from here.
Setup: Put 6 VP here per player.

cards.name: Colonnade
cards.description:
When you buy an Action card, if you have a copy of it in play, take 2 VP from here.
Setup: Put 6 VP here per player.

cards.name: Defiled Shrine
cards.description:
When you gain an Action, move 1 VP from its pile to this.
When you buy a Curse, take the VP from this.
Setup: Put 2 VP on each non-Gathering Action Supply pile.

cards.name: Fountain
cards.description: When scoring, 15 VP if you have at least 10 Coppers.

cards.name: Keep
cards.description: When scoring, 5 VP per differently named Treasure you have, that you have more copies of than each other player, or tied for most.

cards.name: Labyrinth
cards.description:
When you gain a 2nd card in one of your turns, take 2 VP from here.
Setup: Put 6 VP here per player.

cards.name: Mountain Pass
cards.description: When you are the first player to gain a Province, after that turn, each player bids once, up to [40D], ending with you. High bidder gets +8 VP and takes the [D] they bid.

cards.name: Musuem
cards.description: When scoring, 2 VP per differently named card you have.

cards.name: Obelisk
cards.description:
When scoring, 2 VP per card you have from the chosen pile.
Setup: Choose a random Action Supply pile.

cards.name: Orchard
cards.description: When scoring, 4 VP per differently named Action card you have 3 or more copies of.

cards.name: Palace
cards.description: When scoring, 3 VP per set you have of Copper-Silver-Gold.

cards.name: Tomb
cards.description: When you trash a card, +1 VP.

cards.name: Tower
cards.description: When scoring, 1 VP per non-Victory card you have from an empty Supply pile.

cards.name: Triumphal Arch
cards.description: When scoring, 3 VP per copy you have of the 2nd most common Action card among your cards (if it’s a tie, count either).

cards.name: Wall
cards.description: When scoring, -1 VP per card you have after the first 15.

cards.name: Black Market
cards.description:
+$2
Reveal the top 3 cards of the Black Market deck. Play any number of Treasures from your hand. You may buy one of the revealed cards. Put the rest on the bottom of the Black Market deck in any order.
———-
Setup: Make a Black Market deck out of different unused Kingdom cards.

cards.name: Dismantle
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. If it costs $1 or more, gain a cheaper card and a Gold.

cards.name: Envoy
cards.description: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. The player to your left chooses one. Discard that one and put the rest into your hand.

cards.name: Sauna
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
You may play an Avanto from your hand
———
While this is in play, when you play a Silver, you may trash a card from your hand.
(This is the top half of the Sauna/Avanto pile.)

cards.name: Avanto
cards.description:
+ 3 Cards
You may play a Sauna from your hand
(This is the bottom half of the Sauna/Avanto pile.)

cards.name: Walled Village
cards.description:
+1 Card; +2 Actions
—
At the start of Clean-up, if you have this and no more than one other Action card in play, you may put this onto your deck.

cards.name: Governor
cards.description:
+1 Action
Choose one; you get the version in parentheses: Each player gets +1 (+3) Cards; or each player gains a Silver (Gold); or each player may trash a card from their hand and gain a card costing exactly $1 ($2) more.

cards.name: Stash
cards.description:
Worth $2
———-
When shuffling this, you may look through your remaining deck, and may put this anywhere in the shuffled cards.

cards.name: Summon
cards.description: Gain an Action card costing up to $4. Set it aside. If you did, then at the start of your next turn, play it.

cards.name: Prince
cards.description: You may set this aside. If you do, set aside an Action card from your hand costing up to $4. At the start of each of your turns, play that Action, setting it aside again when you discard it from play. (Stop playing it if you fail to set it aside on a turn you play it.)

cards.name: Druid
cards.description:
+1 Buy
Receive one of the set aside, Boons, leaving it there.

Setup: Set aside the top 3 Boons, face-up.

cards.name: Faithful Hound
cards.description:
+2 Cards

When you discard this other than during Clean-up, you may set it aside, and put it into your hand at end of turn.

cards.name: Guardian
cards.description:
Until your next turn, when another player plays an Attack card, it doesn’t affect you. At the start of your next turn, +$1.

This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

cards.name: Monastery
cards.description: For each card you’ve gained this turn, you may trash a card from your hand or a Copper you have in play.

cards.name: Pixie
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Discard the top Boon. You may trash this to receive that Boon twice.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Goat)

cards.name: Goat
cards.description:
Worth $1
When you play this, you may trash a card from your hand.

cards.name: Tracker
cards.description:
+$1.
Receive a Boon.
While this is in play, when you gain a card, you may put that card onto your deck.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Pouch)

cards.name: Pouch
cards.description:
$1
+1 Buy

cards.name: Changeling
cards.description:
$3
Night
Trash this. Gain a copy of a card you have in play.

In games using this, when you gain a card costing $3 or more, you may exchange it for a Changeling.

cards.name: Fool
cards.description:
If you aren’t the player with Lost in the Woods, take it, take 3 Boons, and receive the Boons in any order.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Lucky Coin)

cards.name: Lucky Coin
cards.description:
Worth $1
When you play this, gain a Silver.

cards.name: Lost in the Woods
cards.description: At the start of your turn, you may discard a card to receive a Boon.

cards.name: Ghost Town
cards.description:
At the start of your next turn, +1 Card and +1 Action.

This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

cards.name: Leprechaun
cards.description: Gain a Gold. If you have exactly 7 cards, gain a Wish from its pile. Otherwise, receive a Hex.

cards.name: Night Watchman
cards.description:
Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, discard any number, and put the rest back in any order.

This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

cards.name: Secret Cave
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
You may discard 3 cards. If you did, then at the start of your next turn: +$3.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Magic Lamp)

cards.name: Magic Lamp
cards.description:
$1

When you play this, if there are at least 6 cards that you have exactly 1 copy of in play, trash this. If you do, gain 3 Wishes from their pile.

cards.name: Bard
cards.description:
+$2
Receive a Boon.

cards.name: Blessed Village
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
When you gain this, take a Boon. Receive it now or at the start of your next turn.

cards.name: Cemetery
cards.description:
Worth 2VP

When you gain this, trash up to 4 cards from your hand.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Haunted Mirror)

cards.name: Haunted Mirror
cards.description:
Worth $1

When you trash this, you may discard an Action card, to gain a Ghost from its pile.

cards.name: Conclave
cards.description:
+$2.
You may play an Action card from your hand that you don’t have a copy of in play. If you do, +1 Action.

cards.name: Devil’s Workshop
Imp
cards.description:
+2 Cards
You may play an Action card from your hand that you don’t have a copy of in play.
(This is not in the supply).

cards.name: Exorcist
cards.description: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a cheaper Spirit from one of the Spirit Piles.

cards.name: Necromancer
cards.description:
Play  a face-up non-Duration Action card from the trash leaving it there and turning it face down for the turn.

Setup: Put the 3 Zombies into the trash.

cards.name: Zombie Apprentice
cards.description: You may trash an Action card from your hand for +3 Cards and +1 Action.

cards.name: Zombie Mason
cards.description: Trash the top card of your deck. You may gain a card costing up to $1 more than it.

cards.name: Zombie Spy
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Look at the top card of your deck. Discard it or put it back.

cards.name: Shepherd
cards.description:
+1 Action
Discard any number of Victory cards, revealing them. +2 Cards per card discarded.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Pasture)

cards.name: Pasture
cards.description:
Worth $1

Worth 1VP per Estate you have.

cards.name: Skulk

+1 Buy
Each other player receives the next Hex.

cards.name: Cobbler
cards.description: At the start of your next turn, gain a card to hand costing up to $4.

cards.name: Crypt
cards.description: Set aside any number of Treasures you have in play (under this). While any remain, at the start of each of your turns, put one of them into your hand.

cards.name: Cursed Village

+2 Actions
Draw until you have 6 cards in hand.

When you gain this, receive a Hex.

cards.name: Den of Sin
cards.description:
At the start of your next turn: +2 Cards.

This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

cards.name: Idol
cards.description: When you play this, if you then have an odd number of Idols in play, receive a Boon; if an even number, each other player gains a Curse.

cards.name: Pooka
cards.description:
You may trash a Treasure other than Cursed Gold from your hand for +4 Cards.
(When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Cursed Gold)

cards.name: Cursed Gold
cards.description:
Worth $3
When you play this, gain a Curse.

cards.name: Sacred Grove
cards.description:
+1 Buy
+$3
Receive a Boon. If it doesn’t give +$1, each other player may receive it.

cards.name: Tormentor
cards.description:
+$2
If you have no other cards in play, gain an Imp from its pile. Otherwise, each other player receives the next Hex.

cards.name: Tragic Hero
cards.description:
+3 Cards
+1 Buy
If you have 8 or more cards in hand (after drawing), trash this and gain a Treasure.

cards.name: Vampire
cards.description: Each other player receives the next Hex. Gain a card costing up to $5 other than a Vampire. Exchange this for a Bat.

cards.name: Bat
cards.description:
Trash up to 2 cards from your hand. If you trashed at least one, exchange this for a Vampire.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Werewolf
cards.description: If it’s your Night phase, each other player receives the next Hex. Otherwise, +3 Cards.

cards.name: Raider
cards.description:
Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand discards a copy of a card you have in play (or reveals they can’t).
At the start of your next turn, +$3

+1 Action
Return this to its pile. If you did, gain a card to your hand costing up to $6.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Will-O’-Wisp
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it costs $2 or less, put it into your hand.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: Imp
cards.description:
+2 Cards
You may play an Action card from your hand that you don’t have a copy of in play.
(This is not in the supply).

cards.name: Ghost
cards.description:
Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal an Action. Discard the other cards and set aside the Action. At the start of your next turn, play it twice.
(This is not in the Supply.)

cards.name: The Earth’s Gift
cards.description: You may discard a Treasure card to gain a card costing up to $4.

cards.name: The Field’s Gift
cards.description:
+1 Action
+$1
(Keep this until Clean-up.)

cards.name: The Flame’s Gift
cards.description: You may trash a card from your hand.

+1 Buy
+1 $1
(Keep this until Clean-up.)

cards.name: The Moon’s Gift
cards.description: Look through your discard pile, you may put a card from it onto your deck.

cards.name: The Mountain’s Gift
cards.description: Gain a Silver.

cards.name: The River’s Gift.
cards.description:
+1 Card at the end of this turn.
(Keep this until Clean-up.)

cards.name: The Sea’s Gift
cards.description: +1 Card.

cards.name: The Sky’s Gift
cards.description: You may discard 3 cards to gain a Gold.

cards.name: The Sun’s Gift
cards.description: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Discard any number of them and put the rest back in any order.

cards.name: The Swamp’s Gift
cards.description: Gain a Will-O’-Wisp from its pile.

cards.name: The Wind’s Gift
cards.description: +2 Cards. Discard 2 cards.

cards.name: Bad Omens
cards.description: Put your deck into your discard pile. Look through it and put 2 Coppers from it onto your deck (or reveal you can’t.)

cards.name: Delusion
cards.description: If you don’t have Deluded or Envious, take Deluded.

cards.name: Deluded
cards.description: At the start of your Buy phase, return this, and you can’t buy Actions this turn.

cards.name: Envy
cards.description: If you don’t have Envious or Deluded, take Envious.

cards.name: Envious
cards.description: At the start of your Buy phase, return this, and Silver and Gold make $1 this turn.

cards.name: Famine
cards.description: Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Discard the Actions. Shuffle the rest into your deck.

cards.name: Fear
cards.description: If you have at least 5 cards in hand, discard an Action or Treasure (or reveal you can’t.)

cards.name: Greed
cards.description: Gain a Copper onto your deck.

cards.name: Haunting
cards.description: If you have at least 4 cards in hand, put one of them onto your deck.

cards.name: Locusts
cards.description: Trash the top card of your deck. If it’s Copper or Estate, gain a Curse. Otherwise, gain a cheaper card that shares a type with it.

cards.name: Misery
cards.description: If this is your first Misery this game, take Miserable. Otherwise, flip it over to Twice Miserable.

cards.name: Miserable
cards.description: Worth -2VP

cards.name: Twice Miserable
cards.description: Worth -4VP

cards.name: Plague
cards.description: Gain a Curse to your hand.

cards.name: Poverty
cards.description: Discard down to 3 cards in hand.

cards.name: War
cards.description: Reveal cards from your deck until revealing one costing $3 or $4. Trash it and discard the rest.

cards.name: Border Guard
cards.description: Reveal the top 2 cards of your deck. Put one into your hand and discard the other. If both were Actions, take the Lantern or Horn.

cards.name: Ducat
cards.description:
+1 Coffers
+1 Buy
———-
When you gain this, you may trash a Copper from your hand.

cards.name: Lackeys
cards.description:
+2 Cards
———-
When you gain this, +2 Villagers.

cards.name: Acting Troupe
cards.description:
+4 Villagers
Trash this.

cards.name: Cargo Ship
cards.description:
+$2
Once this turn, when you gain a card, you may set it aside face up (on this). At the start of your next turn, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Experiment
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+1 Action
Return this to the supply.
———-
When you gain this, gain another Experiment (that doesn’t come with another).

cards.name: Improve
cards.description:
+$2
———-
At the start of Clean-up, you may trash an Action card you would discard from play this turn, to gain a card costing exactly $1 more than it.

cards.name: Flag Bearer
cards.description:
+$2
———-
When you gain or trash this, take the Flag.

cards.name: Hideout
cards.description:
+1 Card
+2 Actions
Trash a card from your hand. If it’s a Victory card, gain a Curse.

cards.name: Inventor
cards.description: Gain a card costing up to $4, then cards cost $1 less this turn (but not less than $0).

cards.name: Mountain Village
cards.description:
+2 Actions
Look through your discard pile and put a card from it into your hand; if you can’t, +1 Card.

cards.name: Patron
cards.description:
+1 Villager
+$2
———-
When something causes you to reveal this (using the word “reveal”), +1 Coffers.

cards.name: Priest
cards.description:
+$2
Trash a card from your hand. For the rest of this turn, when you trash a card, +$2.

cards.name: Research
cards.description:
+1 Action
Trash a card from your hand. Per $1 it costs, set aside a card from your deck face down (on this). At the start of your next turn, put those cards into your hand.

cards.name: Silk Merchant
cards.description:
+2 Cards
+1 Buy
———-
When you gain or trash this, +1 Coffers and +1 Villager.

cards.name: Old Witch
cards.description:
+3 Cards
Each other player gains a Curse and may trash a Curse from their hand.

cards.name: Recruiter
cards.description:
+2 Cards
Trash a card from your hand. +1 Villager per $1 it costs.

cards.name: Scepter
cards.description: When you play this, chose one: +$2; or replay an Action card you played this turn that’s still in play.

cards.name: Scholar
cards.description:
Discard your hand.
+7 Cards.

cards.name: Sculptor
cards.description: Gain a card to your hand costing up to $4. If it’s a Treasure, +1 Villager.

cards.name: Seer
cards.description:
+1 Card
+1 Action
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Put the ones costing from $2 to $4 into your hand. Put the rest back in any order.

cards.name: Spices
cards.description:
$2
+1 Buy
———-
When you gain this, +2 Coffers.

cards.name: Swashbuckler
cards.description:
+3 Cards
If your discard pile has any cards in it: +1 Coffers, then if you have at least 4 Coffers tokens, take the Treasure Chest.

cards.name: Treasurer
cards.description:
+$3
Choose one: Trash a Treasure from your hand; or gain a Treasure from the trash to your hand; or take the Key.

cards.name: Villain
cards.description:
+2 Coffers
Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand discards one costing $2 or more (or reveals they can’t).

cards.name: Catherdral
cards.description: At the start of your turn, trash a card from your hand.

cards.name: City Gate
cards.description: At the start of your turn, +1 Card, then put a card from your hand onto your deck.

cards.name: Pageant
cards.description: At the end of your Buy phase, you may pay $1 for +1 Coffers.

cards.name: Sewers
cards.description: When you trash a card other than with this, you may trash a card from your hand.

cards.name: Start Chart
cards.description: When you shuffle, you may pick one of the cards to go on top.

cards.name: Exploration
cards.description: At the end of your Buy phase, if you didn’t buy any cards, +1 Coffers and +1 Villager.

cards.name: Fair
cards.description: At the start of your turn, +1 Buy.

cards.name: Silos
cards.description: At the start of your turn, discard any number of Coppers, revealed, and draw that many cards.

cards.name: Sinister Plot
cards.description: At the start of your turn, add a token here, or remove your tokens here for +1 Card each.

cards.name: Academy
cards.description: When you gain an Action card, +1 Villager.

cards.name: Capitalism
cards.description: During your turns, Actions with +$ amounts in their text are also Treasures.

cards.name: Fleet
cards.description: After the game ends, there’s an extra round of turns just for players with this.

cards.name: Guildhall
cards.description: When you gain a Treasure, +1 Coffers.

cards.name: Piazza
cards.description: At the start of your turn, reveal the top card of your deck. If it’s an Action, play it.

cards.name: Road Network
cards.description: When another player gains a Victory card, +1 Card.

cards.name: Barracks
cards.description: At the start of your turn, +1 Action.

cards.name: Crop Rotation
cards.description: At the start of your turn, you may discard a Victory card for +2 Cards.

cards.name: Innovation
cards.description: The first time you gain an Action card in each of your turns, you may set it aside. If you do, play it.

cards.name: Canal
cards.description: During your turns, cards cost $1 less, but not less than $0.

cards.name: Citadel
cards.description: The first time you play an Action card during each of your turns, play it again afterwards.
